page.title: 05FARMING IN THE GEDNEY AREA
page.content: The farming in this aera is now all arable. Many years ago farmers had pigs and sheep which were taken down the 'drove' roads to graze. All the animals have now gone. The farmers use a lot of machinery and do not need many helpers. Many of the hedges are being removed to make bigger fields. The main crops are potatoes, wheat, sugar beet, and vegtables for freezing and canning. Many flowers are grown in fields for their bulbs. The farmers use a great deal of chemical fertilizers and pesticides. Some people are concerned about the long term effect of these. Farms are getting larger and when they are sold they are often bought as investments by pension finds and city Investments.
